title: Why does not voting in a surrender vote, count as a no?
body:
A surrender vote is successful if over 70% of people wish to surrender.
So why if surrender vote is 3:1, is it not successful?
If someone is indifferent about whether the game is surrendered or not, it should just count the vote out of 4 people rather than 5 and adding the final one as a no.

replies.body:
Because not wishing to leave a game is obvious, while if you wish for an early end then you have to pass the vote with Yes.

Everybody is assumed to vote No by default and it makes perfect sense, otherwise there wouldn't be a match to begin with.

Very good point.
Okay I'm convinced.

Not voting should count as no because %%%%%%s that spam surrender every 5 minutes annoy me, I'm not stopping to hit no every time so I just drag it off the screen at first attempted surrender and leave it there.

if someone is in the middle of a fight when the vote is suggested they wont be paying attention to it escpecially if they are running away for a length of time and it expires and if they didn't want to surrender its not fair to cast their vote as yes.
plus riot want us to play the game so obviously the system will be wired to make that happen

I guess that could happen, but I feel 60 seconds is a enough time for a player to have 1 second to decide if the want to surrender or not, even in a busy fight. 

Also I don't think surrenders mean less games, on the contrary I think people are more likely to be baited in the "just one more" mentality.

I've been in drawn out fights that have lasted up to three minutes, no where in that time period is there time to vote.

I've actually been in a scenario where I have been the last member of team alive 1v4 and my team was voting to surrender while I fended off the enemy team, thankfully someone on my team voted no so it was 3:1:1 because I scored us an ACE that lead to our victory.

Moral of the story: Don't be French.

As simple as it sounds, unless they are no longer in the game. Even without a cast vote they still make up a percentage of the team. 

So it's still technically 3 out of 5 want to surrender, and as it states 70% of the team must agree to surrender. Not 70% of votes. 

Hope that helps.

Well technically it's a 3:1:1 scenario, where one individual has abstained from voting, so it's still not a minimum 70% for yes. Though I agree that an individual who abstains from voting should not be counted at all.
